answer_options.B: They planned to bake a cake next weekend.
answer_options.C: The cookies were decorated with chocolate chips.
answer_options.D: Do you enjoy baking treats too?

answer_explanation: Option A provides a sense of closure by showing Lily's positive feelings and the successful outcome of the baking activity, which wraps up the story on a satisfying note.
subject: ELA

question: You are writing a thank-you note to your grandmother. Which choice is the most appropriate sentence to include?

answer_options.A: Grandma, your gift was really cool!
answer_options.B: Thank you for the lovely gift. I really appreciate it.
answer_options.C: I saw a movie yesterday.
answer_options.D: Gifts are nice to receive.

answer_explanation: Option B is correct because it expresses gratitude in a polite and personal way, which matches the task of writing a thank-you note, the purpose of showing appreciation, and the audience of a grandmother.
subject: ELA

question: You are writing a short paragraph for the school newsletter about your class's science fair project. Which paragraph is most appropriate for the newsletter's audience and purpose?

answer_options.A: Our project was about plants. We grew some beans. It was okay.
answer_options.B: Our third-grade class investigated how different amounts of sunlight affect plant growth. We observed that plants with more sunlight grew taller and had greener leaves. This project helped us learn about the importance of light for plants.
answer_options.C: Science fairs are boring and too much work. I wish we didn't have to do them every year.
answer_options.D: I liked the part where we got to water the plants. My friend thought it was fun to measure them. The teacher said we did a good job.

answer_explanation: Option B is correct because it clearly describes the project's purpose, methods, and findings in a way that is informative and engaging for the school newsletter audience, which includes parents, students, and staff. It maintains an appropriate formal yet accessible tone suitable for sharing educational achievements.
subject: ELA

question: You are writing a thank-you note to your teacher to thank her for a gift. Which choice is most appropriate for this task, purpose, and audience?

answer_options.A: Hey, thanks for the gift. It's cool.
answer_options.B: Dear Mrs. Smith, Thank you for the thoughtful gift. I really appreciate it.
answer_options.C: Gifts are nice. I like getting presents.
answer_options.D: To whom it may concern, I acknowledge receipt of your gift.

answer_explanation: Option B is correct because it uses a respectful salutation, directly expresses gratitude in a polite manner, and maintains an appropriate level of formality for addressing a teacher, which aligns with the task of writing a thank-you note, the purpose of thanking, and the audience of a teacher.
subject: ELA

question: After writing a story, you want to make it better. Which choice shows using guidance to strengthen your writing?

answer_options.A: Ask a classmate to read it and suggest places to add more details.
answer_options.B: Write the story again without changing anything.
answer_options.C: Draw a picture to go with the story.
answer_options.D: Read it to yourself and think it's perfect.

answer_explanation: Option A is correct because it involves seeking guidance from a peer to develop and strengthen the writing by adding more details, which directly aligns with the standard's focus on improving writing with support.
subject: ELA

question:
Leo wrote this draft for his story about a sunny day:

'The sun was bright. We played outside. It was hot. I drank water.'

His teacher says, 'Your sentences are choppy. Try combining them to create smoother flow, and add sensory details to help readers imagine the scene.'
A classmate adds, 'I'd like to know how you felt while playing.'

Which choice best shows Leo developing and strengthening his writing with guidance from peers and adults?

answer_options.A: Plan a brief outline focusing on setting, action, and feeling; revise by combining sentences and adding details about the heat and joy of playing; then edit for punctuation and capitalization.
answer_options.B: Only fix the punctuation by adding periods at the end of each sentence and capitalizing the first word, without making any other changes.
answer_options.C: Insert intensifiers like 'very' and 'extremely' into each short sentence but keep them separate, such as 'The very bright sun. We extremely played outside.'
answer_options.D: Scrap this draft and begin writing a completely new story about a rainy day instead.

answer_explanation: Option A is correct because it demonstrates the full process of developing and strengthening writing with guidance: planning with an outline, revising by combining sentences and adding sensory and emotional details as suggested by the teacher and classmate, and editing for conventions such as punctuation and capitalization.
subject: ELA

question: After writing a draft, Leo gets advice from his teacher to make his story better. Which choice best shows Leo using the guidance to strengthen his writing?

answer_options.A: Leo copies the story again without any changes.
answer_options.B: Leo adds a sentence to describe the setting and fixes two misspelled words.
answer_options.C: Leo asks the teacher to rewrite the story for him.
answer_options.D: Leo changes the title and makes the letters bigger.

answer_explanation: Option B is correct because it shows Leo strengthening his writing by revising (adding a descriptive sentence to improve content) and editing (fixing spelling errors), which aligns with using guidance to develop and improve writing as described in the standard.
subject: ELA

question: Which choice shows using technology to produce and publish writing?

answer_options.A: Write a story with a pencil and put it in your desk
answer_options.B: Type a story on a computer and post it on the class website
answer_options.C: Draw a picture on a tablet and show it to your teacher
answer_options.D: Read a story aloud from a book

answer_explanation: Option B is correct because typing on a computer uses technology to produce the writing, and posting it on the class website publishes it by making it available for others to see.
subject: ELA

question: Which scenario best demonstrates a third-grade student using technology to produce and publish writing with guidance from an adult?

answer_options.A: Typing a story on a classroom tablet, emailing it to the teacher for feedback, and then posting it on the class website after approval.
answer_options.B: Writing a story by hand and reading it aloud to the class during story time.
answer_options.C: Using a computer to type a story but keeping it saved on the desktop without sharing it.
answer_options.D: Recording an audio version of a story and sharing it with friends without any adult involvement.

answer_explanation: Option A is correct because it shows the student using technology (typing on a tablet) to produce writing, publishing it by posting on the class website, and receiving guidance through teacher feedback and approval.
subject: ELA

question: Which choice best shows a third-grader using technology, with a teacher's help, to produce and publish writing?

answer_options.A: Writing a story in a notebook and reading it to the class.
answer_options.B: Typing a poem on a computer and saving it to a folder.
answer_options.C: Typing a story on a tablet, then with the teacher's assistance, posting it on the class website.
answer_options.D: Handwriting a letter, scanning it, and emailing it to a pen pal.

answer_explanation: Option C is correct because the student uses technology (typing on a tablet) to produce the writing and, with the teacher's help, publishes it by posting it on the class website.
subject: ELA

question: Which choice shows how to do a short research project about dolphins?

answer_options.A: Drawing a picture of a dolphin from imagination
answer_options.B: Reading a book about dolphins and writing down two facts
answer_options.C: Making up a story about a dolphin adventure
answer_options.D: Watching a cartoon about dolphins without taking notes

answer_explanation: Option B is correct because conducting a short research project involves building knowledge by gathering information from sources, such as books, and recording what you learn about the topic.
subject: ELA

question: A student is conducting a short research project on volcanoes. She has read a book and watched a documentary. Which choice shows how she can best build knowledge from these sources?

answer_options.A: Write down only the facts from the book.
answer_options.B: Create a poster that combines key information from both the book and the documentary.
answer_options.C: Tell a friend what she saw in the documentary without using the book.
answer_options.D: Copy sentences directly from the documentary's script.

answer_explanation: Option B is correct because synthesizing information from multiple sources into a cohesive product, such as a poster, actively builds and demonstrates new knowledge, which is the core objective of conducting a short research project.
subject: ELA

question: Marco wants to learn about the solar system for a class project. Which choice shows that he is conducting a short research project that builds knowledge?

answer_options.A: He looks at a poster of planets and colors a picture.
answer_options.B: He copies a paragraph from a website without reading it carefully.
answer_options.C: He reads a library book, watches an educational video, and writes down notes about key planets and their features.
answer_options.D: He asks his friend what their favorite planet is and writes only that answer.

answer_explanation: Option C is correct because it involves using multiple reliable sources (a book and a video) and taking organized notes on specific information, which are essential steps in conducting a short research project that builds knowledge about a topic.
subject: ELA

question: Liam is writing a report about planets. Which choice shows a good way to gather information from a source?

answer_options.A: He draws a picture of a planet from his imagination.
answer_options.B: He reads a book about space and writes down three important facts in his own words.
answer_options.C: He asks his friend what they think planets are made of.
answer_options.D: He copies every sentence from a website without writing any notes.

answer_explanation: Option B is correct because it involves gathering information from a print source (a book) and taking brief notes, which aligns with the standard W.3.8's focus on gathering information from sources.
subject: ELA

question: For a report on desert plants, a student must sort evidence into 'Root Adaptations' and 'Stem Adaptations.' They have this information: Book: 'Mesquite trees have deep roots to reach water.' Website: 'Cacti have thick stems to store water.' They also recall: 'I saw a plant with shallow roots in sandy soil.' According to W.3.8, which option demonstrates correctly recalling information from experiences and gathering information from provided sources, with notes sorted into the categories?

answer_options.A: Root Adaptations: Deep roots (book), shallow roots (experience). Stem Adaptations: Thick stems (website).
answer_options.B: Root Adaptations: Deep roots. Stem Adaptations: Thick stems. Experience: Shallow roots.
answer_options.C: All adaptations: Deep roots, thick stems, shallow roots.
answer_options.D: Root Adaptations: Book says deep roots. Stem Adaptations: Website says thick stems. Experience not included.

answer_explanation: Option A is correct because it recalls information from personal experience ('shallow roots') and gathers information from provided sources ('deep roots' from the book, 'thick stems' from the website), sorting each piece into the appropriate categories as required by W.3.8 for taking brief notes and organizing evidence.
subject: ELA

question: Sam is researching how plants grow. He remembers watering his plant at home. He also reads a sentence from a website: 'Plants need sunlight, water, and soil to grow.' Which option shows the best way for Sam to take brief notes on his sources and experiences?

answer_options.A: Write 'I watered my plant' and 'Plants need sun, water, soil.'
answer_options.B: Copy the whole sentence from the website without any note about his experience.
answer_options.C: Only write about his memory and ignore the website.
answer_options.D: Make up a note without using his memory or the website.

answer_explanation: Option A is correct because Sam writes brief notes that recall information from his personal experience (watering his plant) and gather key information from the website source (plants need sunlight, water, and soil). This aligns with the standard of recalling information from experiences or gathering information from sources and taking brief notes.
subject: ELA
